knitted from this pattern children of gaza socks zanete hussain ©2025 difficulty other notes intermediate in stranded knitting one yarn will appear slightly more dominant than the other construction notes depending on how the strands are carried these socks start from the toe using judy s behind the work the strand that comes magic cast-on we shape the toe with lifted from above travels slightly farther than the increases when we reach the instep the one that comes from below it is slightly contrast colour is joined and we follow the tighter causing it to create smaller stitches colourwork chart rather than the sides recede and be less dominant the yarn we place the gusset increases at the travelling the shortest distance is the bottom of the sole we shape the bottom of dominant yarn therefore it is the heel using short row then a slip-stitch recommended to keep the contrast colour heel flap is worked back and forth in the to the left of the main colour and always main colour we follow the colourwork take it from the bottom to make it stand chart again for the leg until we reach the out more the most important thing is to be preferred length and finish with a 1x1 rib consistent with the position of each strand and tubular bind-off schematic finished measurements intended ease 0 cm / 0 centimetres 1 2 3 4 a foot circumference 17 5 20 22 5 25 b foot length 22 24 5
